result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany E Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Progam and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 159 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any current sentence.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Ohio.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Wal Mart to be paid Joint and Several as a condition of probation.
Extradition fees to be paid as a condition of probation. Other court costs were waived.

Court waives DNA Surcharge and Specimen. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. No Contact with WalMart stores. No Contact with the co-defendant. 
7/17/2015: COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO OBTAINED. SURCHARGE REMAINS WAIVED.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Filed by the State requesting that the Court require the defendant to provide a biological specimen.

Defendant Tiffany E Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months) CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence.  STAYED.  Credit for 159 days if revoked. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.  Probation may be transferred to Ohio.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution in the amount of $6,220.96 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) to Walmart as a Condition of Probation
- Extradition fees in the amount of $446.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with Walmart stores.  No contact with codefendant.
Sentencing hearing on March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tiffany E Glover in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith Jr for attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 6, Court conducts plea colloquy,  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 7 is dismissed and read in. State requests a presentence investigiation. Court Orders a presentence investigation to be completed within 45 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Bail is revoked.
